title: About VistaKine
description: Information about the VistaKine platform, its purpose, and how to use it.

sections.title: Introduction to VistaKine
sections.content: Welcome to VistaKine, an innovative educational platform designed to make kinematics and physics concepts more accessible through interactive visualizations and clear, structured content.

sections.title: Purpose
sections.content:
VistaKine was created to address the challenges many students face when learning physics concepts, particularly in kinematics. Our goal is to provide a visual, interactive learning experience that complements traditional textbooks and classroom instruction.

By combining clear explanations with interactive visualizations, we aim to help students build intuition and deeper understanding of physics concepts that can often seem abstract.

sections.title: Key Features
sections.content:
• Interactive Visualizations: Manipulate variables and see physics concepts in action
  • Structured Learning Path: Progress through concepts in a logical sequence
  • Problem Examples: Learn through worked solutions to common physics problems
  • Practice Problems: Test your understanding with challenging exercises
  • Dynamic Content: Content that adjusts to your screen size and learning needs

sections.title: How to Use VistaKine
sections.content:
Navigating VistaKine is designed to be intuitive:

  • Use the sidebar chapter navigation to move between major topics
  • Expand chapters to see and select section topics
  • Use the progress bar at the top of content pages to track your reading and move between related topics
  • Interact with visualizations using the provided controls
  • The search feature allows you to quickly find relevant content

sections.title: Development Team
sections.content: VistaKine is developed by a passionate team of educators, physicists, and web developers committed to improving physics education. We continuously work to enhance the platform based on student feedback and educational research.

sections.title: Feedback and Contributions
sections.content: We welcome feedback and suggestions for improving VistaKine. If you have ideas for new visualizations, spot any errors, or want to contribute content, please reach out to us at feedback@vistakine.edu.

sections.title: Technology
sections.content: Interactions have been created using three.js and cannon.js

sections.title: Attribution and Licensing
sections.content:
VistaKine's content is available under a Creative Commons BY-NC-SA license, meaning you're free to use and adapt our materials for non-commercial purposes, as long as you provide attribution and share under the same license.

Some visualizations incorporate open-source libraries and resources, with specific attributions provided in the relevant sections.

sections.title: Updates and Roadmap
sections.content:
VistaKine is continuously evolving. Upcoming features include:

  • Additional topics covering dynamics, energy, and more advanced physics concepts
  • Enhanced visualization capabilities
  • Personalized learning tracks
  • Integration with common learning management systems
  • Offline access capabilities
